thobe.logfileviewer.plugin.api

Interface IPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ILogStreamDataListener, ILogStreamRequester, IMemoryWatchable, IPluginBase

    public interface IPlugin
extends IPluginBase, IMemoryWatchable, ILogStreamDataListener, ILogStreamRequester
    Author:
    Thomas Obenaus

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ILogStream getLogstream()
      Returns a reference to the currently open LogStream.
      boolean isQuitRequested()
      Returns true if previously the method quit() was called.

      HIDDEN-Method: This method has not to be implemented by a specific IPlugin.

      Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 3c CLOSE LS #####
      The LogStream was closed.

      A new LogStream was opened.
      void onPrepareCloseLogStream()
      Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 3a PREPARE CLOSE LS #####
      The currently open LogStream will be closed.
      boolean onRegistered(IPluginAccess pluginAccess)
      Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 2 REGISTER #####
      All Plugins are registered and running.
      boolean onStarted()
      Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 1 START #####
      All Plugins are started (run-method entered for the first time) but not registered.
      boolean onStopped()
      Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 5 STOP #####
      The Plugin is stopped --> it has to guarantee to leave its run-method as quick as possible: Use Plugin.isQuitRequested() to check if the run-method should be left.
      void onUnRegistered()
      Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 4 UNREGISTER #####
      All Plugins are unregistered (not available any more) but still running.
      void quit()
      Quits the Plugin by setting the quitRequested variable.

      • Methods inherited from interface thobe.logfileviewer.plugin.api.IPluginBase

        getBugfixVersion, getMajorVersion, getMinorVersion, getPluginApiVersion, getPluginDescription, getPluginName

      • Methods inherited from interface thobe.logfileviewer.plugin.memory.IMemoryWatchable

        freeMemory, getMemory, getNameOfMemoryWatchable

      • Methods inherited from interface thobe.logfileviewer.plugin.source.logstream.ILogStreamDataListener

        getLineFilter, onNewBlockOfLines, onNewLine

      • Methods inherited from interface thobe.logfileviewer.plugin.source.logstream.ILogStreamRequester

        getLSRequesterName, response

    • Method Detail

      • isQuitRequested

        boolean isQuitRequested()
        Returns true if previously the method quit() was called.
        Returns:

      • quit

        void quit()
        Quits the Plugin by setting the quitRequested variable. Each Plugin has to guarantee to leave its run-method as soon as possible. The state of this variable can be requested via Plugin.isQuitRequested()

      • onStarted

        boolean onStarted()
        Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 1 START #####
        All Plugins are started (run-method entered for the first time) but not registered.
        Returns:

      • onRegistered

        boolean onRegistered(IPluginAccess pluginAccess)
        Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 2 REGISTER #####
        All Plugins are registered and running.
        Parameters:
        pluginAccess - - object to access other Plugins that are registered/ available.
        Returns:

      • onLogStreamAvailable

        void onLogStreamAvailable(ILogStreamAccess logStreamAccess)
        HIDDEN-Method: This method has not to be implemented by a specific IPlugin. The corresponding method for the IPlugins to be implemented is onLogStreamOpened(). Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 2a LS AVAILABLE #####
        A new LogStream is available plugins will gain access to this stream over ILogStreamAccess and will be registered as ILogStreamDataListener.
        Parameters:
        logStreamAccess - - the object that can be used to access the LogStream by registering a ILogStreamDataListener via ILogStreamAccess.addLogStreamDataListener(ILogStreamDataListener).

      • onLogStreamOpened

        void onLogStreamOpened()
        Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 2b OPEN LS #####
        A new LogStream was opened. Now access to the LogStream over IPlugin#getLogstreamAccess() is granted/save.

      • onPrepareCloseLogStream

        void onPrepareCloseLogStream()
        Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 3a PREPARE CLOSE LS #####
        The currently open LogStream will be closed. The access to the LogStream over IPlugin#getLogstreamAccess() is not longer granted and might return a null-pointer.

      • onLogStreamLeavingScope

        void onLogStreamLeavingScope()
        HIDDEN-Method: This method has not to be implemented by a specific IPlugin. The corresponding method for the IPlugins to be implemented is onPrepareCloseLogStream(). Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 3b LS LEAVING SCOPE #####
        The currently open LogStream will be closed. The access to the LogStream over IPlugin#getLogstreamAccess() is not longer granted and might return a null-pointer.

      • onLogStreamClosed

        void onLogStreamClosed()
        Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 3c CLOSE LS #####
        The LogStream was closed.

      • onUnRegistered

        void onUnRegistered()
        Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 4 UNREGISTER #####
        All Plugins are unregistered (not available any more) but still running.

      • onStopped

        boolean onStopped()
        Life-cycle of Plugin: ##### Step 5 STOP #####
        The Plugin is stopped --> it has to guarantee to leave its run-method as quick as possible:
        1. Use Plugin.isQuitRequested() to check if the run-method should be left. Or
        2. Set your own internal flag if onStopped() is called and check this flag in the Plugins run-method.
        Returns:

      • getLogstream

        ILogStream getLogstream()
        Returns a reference to the currently open LogStream. Might return a null-pointer.
        Returns:
